meanings.definition: A person who takes an exam or course again.
meanings.sent1: The retaker studied hard to improve their grade.
meanings.sent2: The teacher noticed that the retaker was determined to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The retaker joked that they were becoming a professional test-taker.
meanings.sent4: Being a retaker felt like running a marathon with hurdles.
meanings.sent5: The retaker's perseverance was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: To take an exam or course again.
meanings.sent1: She decided to retaker the math test to boost her score.
meanings.sent2: He will retaker the class next semester to improve his understanding.
meanings.sent3: The student had to retaker the exam after forgetting to bring a pencil.
meanings.sent4: Retakering the course felt like hitting the reset button on his education.
meanings.sent5: The decision to retaker the test paid off with a higher grade.
